commit_message:
Item filtering in Mistral

Change-Id: I80370c513f0ded6121bdce93f46fb9aa6e23eb38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral-specs refs/changes/75/269975/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= Item filtering in Mistral ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-items-filtering Problem description =================== Currently, we don't have any support for items filtering. It is very difficult to find specific data from the list api. For example, we have a lot of 'standard' OpenStack actions. So it is not very convenient to look through all of them to find actions for nova Use Cases --------- As a user, I want to see only filtered data. Proposed change =============== To solve this problem, I would like to add new parameter to endpoints. We already have 'marker', 'limit', 'sort_dirs' and 'sort_keys' parameters. New 'f' parameter will be added. I would like to use just 'f' instead of 'filter' because user can filter as much column as he/she want, So it will increase url length unnecessarily if we use 'filter'. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- 1. Gets only those actions which have 'nova' as tag value. GET http://127.0.0.1:8989/v2/actions?f.field=tag&f.type=string&f.value=nova Same change is proposed for workflows, workbooks, cron triggers, executions, tasks etc. End user impact --------------- User can add new oprtion in CLI. For instance :: mistral action-list --filter tag=nova Performance Impact ------------------ None Deployer impact --------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- hardik <hardik.parekh@nectechnologies.in> Work Items ---------- * Add new parameter to REST api. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Tests should cover all the scenarios memtioned in use cases section. References ========== [1]: https://review.openstack.org/269971

commit_message:
Officially deprecate rollback for introspection rules

This was designed to clean up action effects, but proved too confusing.
We should recommend using explicit clean up action instead.

Change-Id: Ia414979956cc0cbd5ed040831c49dba18671f86d

commit_message:
Updates external DNS service if IP address changes

Previously the external DNS service was only notified when dns_name
was updated in a port, but it should also be alerted when the IP
address changes. This patch propogates the changes invoked in a port
update to the external DNS service when either the dns_name or the IP
address of a port changes.

Change-Id: I319f7a3265caaee5edaab19695a99d84e8e9a8ab
Closes-Bug: 1554207

commit_message:
Allow users to change their own email address

Adds a new dashboard to change own email address.

Users without admin rights can't get their current email address
thus the corresponding form field is empty, but a successful
change displays the new email address in the modal popup.

This change only for Keystone V3 api because keystone
V2 api doesn't supports non-admin users to update
their email address.

So for the users who are using keystone V2 api,
the email change panel will be hidden.

Restored from I375926b8ef86dcf0c431c8674d01e04a8e953178
Closes bug: #884492
Co-Authored-By: nikunj2512 <nikunj.aggarwal@hp.com>

Change-Id: I79e33d8d0a01eec16383fcf91f2a59b67efdf82a

commit_message:
Firmware update(iLO) as manual cleaning step

Added firmware file processing (download, checksum verification,
extraction) logic. It uses proliantutils to do the actual
firmware update through the iLO.

Partial-Bug: #1526216
Depends On: I0e34407133684e34c4ab9446b3521a24f3038f92
Depends On: I1eca5a08d808df1c4bda0e91181a8389d053c379

added_lines: import six if six.PY3: import io file = io.BytesIO @mock.patch.object(ilo_management, '_execute_ilo_clean_step', spec_set=True, autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(ilo_management.firmware_processor, 'get_fw_processor', spec_set=True, autospec=True) def test_update_firmware_calls_clean_step_foreach_url( self, get_fw_processor_mock, clean_step_mock): with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: # ------------------------------------------------------------------- # GIVEN # ------------------------------------------------------------------- task.node.driver_info = {'ilo_firmware_urls': ['file://any_path', 'http://any_url', 'swift://container/object']} get_fw_processor_mock.return_value.process_fw_on.side_effect = [ 'fw_location_for_filepath', 'fw_location_for_httppath', 'fw_location_for_swiftpath', ] # --------------------------------------------------------------- # WHEN # --------------------------------------------------------------- task.driver.management.update_firmware(task) # --------------------------------------------------------------- # THEN # --------------------------------------------------------------- calls = [mock.call(task.node, 'update_firmware', 'fw_location_for_filepath'), mock.call(task.node, 'update_firmware', 'fw_location_for_httppath'), mock.call(task.node, 'update_firmware', 'fw_location_for_swiftpath'), ] clean_step_mock.assert_has_calls(calls) self.assertTrue(clean_step_mock.call_count == 3) @mock.patch.object(ilo_management, 'LOG') @mock.patch.object(ilo_management, '_execute_ilo_clean_step', spec_set=True, autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(ilo_management.firmware_processor, 'get_fw_processor') def test_update_firmware_simply_returns_for_no_url(self, get_fw_processor_mock, clean_step_mock, LOG_mock): with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: # ------------------------------------------------------------------- # GIVEN # ------------------------------------------------------------------- task.node.driver_info = {} # --------------------------------------------------------------- # WHEN # --------------------------------------------------------------- task.driver.management.update_firmware(task) # --------------------------------------------------------------- # THEN # --------------------------------------------------------------- self.assertFalse(clean_step_mock.called) LOG_mock.warn.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY) @mock.patch.object(ilo_management, '_execute_ilo_clean_step', spec_set=True, autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(ilo_management.firmware_processor, 'get_fw_processor', spec_set=True, autospec=True) def test_update_firmware_throws_error_if_any_url_is_invalid( self, get_fw_processor_mock, clean_step_mock): with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: # ------------------------------------------------------------------- # GIVEN # ------------------------------------------------------------------- task.node.driver_info = {'ilo_firmware_urls': ['any_invalid_url']} get_fw_processor_mock.side_effect = ilo_error.IloInvalidInputError # --------------------------------------------------------------- # WHEN & THEN # --------------------------------------------------------------- self.assertRaises(exception.IloOperationError, task.driver.management.update_firmware, task) self.assertFalse(clean_step_mock.called)

commit_message:
Hacking rules: Added check for notify callbacks duplicate

It may happen to accidentally subscribe a callback for notification
with exact signature as a previously declared one.
This could lead to callbacks called multiple times: so long as callbacks
are designed to be idempotent, this is fine, but if they aren't, then
this could lead to unexpected results.

This hacking rule identifies and warns about duplicated signatures

Change-Id: If1179f38be13b90a0a5bfc1cca8037a7ee1183f1
Closes-Bug: #1547283

commit_message:
Moves the swift start/stop into the common_functions.sh file

Since swift isn't managed by pacemaker we need to manually (systemctl)
stop and start the swift services. This moves the duplicate blocks for
start/stop into a common function (we already include that
pacemaker_common_functions.sh here so may as well)

Change-Id: Ic4f23212594c1bf9edc39143bf60c7f6d648fd1d
(cherry picked from commit 31b884a2a8749452ebd2923f6a97c5d2bec5aa9d)

commit_message:
Heat integration tests failing against https endpoints

Provide ca_file option to pass the ca certificate to verify https
connection. Also pass verify parameter to the test cases which
directly call requests library methods.

Change-Id: I4a81047136d6a64b151180e95c254edea8165349
Closes-Bug: #1553898

commit_message:
Fix config generation for Neutron auth options

Keystoneauth auth plugins by default return their own option objects.
To properly generate a sample config they have to be converted to oslo.config
option objects first.

Change-Id: Ifb1f63d2465aff72b0914989faa9f244a60a947c
Closes-Bug: #1553231
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/288513/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: opts.append(plugin_option._to_oslo_opt())
